name: meta-math/MetaMathQA
description: MetaMathQA is a dataset of mathematical question-answering data, created by augmenting the training sets of GSM8K and MATH. This dataset is not derived from the testing sets of either source dataset, ensuring that it provides a challenging and diverse set of questions for large language models (LLMs) to answer. The dataset is fully fine-tuned on the MetaMathQA datasets using the Mistral-7B model, a powerful language model that has been fine-tuned on a wide range of tasks. MetaMathQA is an important resource for researchers and developers working on mathematical QA tasks, as it provides a large and diverse dataset for training and evaluating LLMs, and it can help improve the performance of LLMs on mathematical QA tasks.
citeAs: @article{yu2023metamath,   title={MetaMath: Bootstrap Your Own Mathematical Questions for Large Language Models},   author={Yu, Longhui and Jiang, Weisen and Shi, Han and Yu, Jincheng and Liu, Zhengying and Zhang, Yu and Kwok, James T and Li, Zhenguo and Weller, Adrian and Liu, Weiyang},   journal={arXiv preprint arXiv:2309.12284},   year={2023} }
creator: meta-math
